TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed X509KeyStorageFlags extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines where and how to import the private key of an X.509 certificate.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyStorageFlags DefaultKeySet = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The default key set is used. The user key set is usually the default.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyStorageFlags Exportable = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Imported keys are marked as exportable.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyStorageFlags MachineKeySet = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Private keys are stored in the local computer store rather than the current user store.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyStorageFlags PersistKeySet = int32(16)

Docs.summary: The key associated with a PFX file is persisted when importing a certificate.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyStorageFlags UserKeySet = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Private keys are stored in the current user store rather than the local computer store. This occurs even if the certificate specifies that the keys should go in the local computer store.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyStorageFlags UserProtected = int32(8)

Docs.summary: Notify the user through a dialog box or other method that the key is accessed. The Cryptographic Service Provider (CSP) in use defines the precise behavior.
